article.title: Essentials of Export Controls and Technology and Encryption Controls
article.summary: Learn more about the Essentials of Export Controls and Technology and Encryption Controls event to be held in November 2014 in Pittsburgh, PA.
article.content:
​​​


The Bureau of Industry and Security, in partnership with the Western Pennsylvania District Export Council and supported by Pittsburgh office of the U.S. Commercial Service, will host two days of in-depth instruction on U.S. export controls in Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania.


Overview

Day One(Essentials of Export Controls) is a comprehensive seminar on U.S. export control requirements for commercial items as well as some military items. The seminar is ideal for exporters looking to understand and comply with the U.S. Export Administration Regulations.

Day Two(Technology and Encryption Controls) will build on the knowledge from Day One by focusing further on export control issues specific to software, technology, and encryption.

Please note that Day One is not specific to the technology sector and would be ideal for any company regardless of their industry sector that have items subject to the U.S. Export Administration. While Day Two is specific to the technology sector, it is strongly recommended to attend Day One unless there is already a strong working knowledge of U.S. export controls.

Event Descriptions

Day One - Essentials of Export Controls – TuesdayNov 18, 2014

The Essentials of Export Controls is a comprehensive one-day seminar ideal for exporting companies that want to understand how to comply with U.S. export control requirements on commercial items as well as some military items.

Instructors from the Bureau of Industry and Security will cover what items and activities are subject to the EAR; steps to take to determine the export licensing requirements for your item; how to determine your export control classification number (ECCN); when you can export or reexport without applying for a license; export clearance procedures and record keeping requirements; and real life examples in applying this information.

Sample Agenda for Essentials of Export Controls

Day 2 - Technology and Encryption Workshop – Wednesday Nov 19, 2014

The Technology and Encryption Workshop is a full-day program that will offer a comprehensive look at how to comply with the U.S. export and reexport controls relating to technology, software and encryption. Discussion will focus on the regulatory requirements relating to technology and software, including what is considered an export or reexport of technology or software; the kinds of technology and software subject to the EAR; how to determine the Export Control Classification Number; license exceptions; and the unique application requirements of technology and software.

The program will also discuss how items with encryption functionality are classified under the EAR; how the provision for >64-bit "mass market" encryption may apply to products that you use, sell or buy; license exception provisions for encryption source code (open source and proprietary); license exception provisions for U.S. subsidiaries and certain eligible countries and for U.S.-origin encryption parts and components incorporated into foreign products; encryption classification and reporting requirements; Encryption Licensing Arrangements; conditions placed on encryption licenses, and encryption technology issues.

It is recommended that companies not already well familiar with export controls also attend the Essentials of Export Control seminar to build a working knowledge of export controls.

Sample of agenda for the Technology and Encryption Controls Workshop


Event Details

DateTopicCost
Tue Nov 18Essentials of Export Controls$205
Wed Nov 19Technology and Encryption Controls$205
$410 for both days
Fee includes course materials, continental breakfast, lunch and refreshments. ​
LocationSheraton Station Square
300 West Station Square Drive
Pittsburgh, PA 15219
Directions​
Time8:15 am to 5:00 pm
Registration begins at 7:30 am

To register please visithttps://www.regonline.com/PittsburghExportContols2014

Cancelation Policy: Refunds for Cancellation after November 11, 2014 will not be provide but substitutions will be accepted.

​ ​

​​

Overnight Accommodations

A block of rooms has been reserved at the Sheraton Station Square Hotel at a conference rate of $128 per night. Reservations can be made by calling 412-261-2000.

Questions or Assistance

For questions or assistance please contact Steven Murray at 412-644-2819 / steven.murray@trade.gov.​
